subject: Re: [junit] Testing Abstract Classes
msgSnippet: ... I guess that definition is in line with the default Adapter classes provided in the JDK. I always rather think of an Adapter as a component that converts
messageBody:
>
>
> > > One exception is the empty Strategy, otherwise known as
> > > an Adapter.
> >
> > That's a different definition of Adapter than I'm used to (or a
> > different application).
>
> Ditto.
>
> Here is mine: an adapter is a class implementing with empty bodies some
> of
> or all the methods of an interface. You can extend Adapters when you only
> want to implement a few methods of an interface but not all of them.
>
>
I guess that definition is in line with the default Adapter classes provided
in the JDK. I always rather think of an Adapter as a component that converts
the interface of a component to match the interface of another, as I think
it is defined in the GoF book. Don't know what does that have to do with an
empty strategy, or what is an empty strategy though. But I'm sure we will
soon know :).


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
